columns.Description: Date and time when the record was generated
columns.Name: Timestamp

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the device in the service
columns.Name: DeviceId

columns.Description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the device
columns.Name: DeviceName

columns.Description: Version of the endpoint agent or sensor running on the machine
columns.Name: ClientVersion

columns.Description: Public IP address used by the onboarded machine to connect to the Windows Defender ATP service. This could be the IP address of the machine itself, a NAT device, or a proxy
columns.Name: PublicIP

columns.Description: Architecture of the operating system running on the machine
columns.Name: OSArchitecture

columns.Description: Platform of the operating system running on the device. This indicates specific operating systems, including variations within the same family, such as Windows 10 and Windows 7
columns.Name: OSPlatform

columns.Description: Build version of the operating system running on the machine
columns.Name: OSBuild

columns.Description: Boolean indicator of whether machine is joined to the Microsoft Entra ID
columns.Name: IsAzureADJoined

columns.Description: The device's Microsoft Entra ID join type
columns.Name: JoinType

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the device in Microsoft Entra ID
columns.Name: AadDeviceId

columns.Description: List of all users that are logged on the machine at the time of the event in JSON array format
columns.Name: LoggedOnUsers

columns.Description: Device tag added through the registry
columns.Name: RegistryDeviceTag

columns.Description: Version of the operating system running on the machine
columns.Name: OSVersion

columns.Description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine
columns.Name: MachineGroup

columns.Description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter.To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the DeviceName and Timestamp columns.
columns.Name: ReportId

columns.Description: Indicates whether the device is currently onboarded or not to Microsoft Defender For Endpoint or if the device is not supported
columns.Name: OnboardingStatus

columns.Description: Additional information about the entity or event
columns.Name: AdditionalFields

columns.Description: Broader classification that groups certain device types under the following categories: Endpoint, Network device, IoT, Unknown
columns.Name: DeviceCategory

columns.Description: Type of device based on purpose and functionality, such as network device, workstation, server, mobile, gaming console, or printer
columns.Name: DeviceType

columns.Description: Additional modifier for certain types of devices; for example, a mobile device can be a tablet or a smartphone; only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute
columns.Name: DeviceSubtype

columns.Description: Model name or number of the product from the vendor or manufacturer; only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute
columns.Name: Model

columns.Description: Name of the product vendor or manufacturer; only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute
columns.Name: Vendor

columns.Description: Distribution of the OS platform, such as Ubuntu or RedHat for Linux platforms
columns.Name: OSDistribution

columns.Description: Additional information about the OS version, such as the popular name, code name, or version number
columns.Name: OSVersionInfo

columns.Description: Previous device IDs that have been assigned to the same device.
columns.Name: MergedDeviceIds

columns.Description: The most recent device ID assigned to a device
columns.Name: MergedToDeviceId

columns.Description: Indicates whether the device is internet-facing
columns.Name: IsInternetFacing

columns.Description: Indicates health of the device’s EDR sensor, if onboarded to Microsoft Defender For Endpoint
columns.Name: SensorHealthState

columns.Description: Determines if the device is excluded from different views and reports in the portal
columns.Name: IsExcluded

columns.Description: The reason for the device being excluded
columns.Name: ExclusionReason

columns.Description: The device's level of vulnerability to exploitation based on its exposure score; can be: Low, Medium, High
columns.Name: ExposureLevel

columns.Description: Priority or value assigned to the device in relation to its importance in computing the organization's exposure score; can be: Low, Normal (Default), High
columns.Name: AssetValue

columns.Description: Device tags created manually using the portal UI or public API
columns.Name: DeviceManualTags

columns.Description: Device tags added and removed dynamically based on dynamic rules
columns.Name: DeviceDynamicTags

columns.Description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) of the device’s hardware
columns.Name: HardwareUuid

columns.Description: The cloud platforms that the device belongs to—can be Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform and Azure Arc
columns.Name: CloudPlatforms

columns.Description: Unique identifier assigned to the device in Azure
columns.Name: AzureVmId

columns.Description: Unique identifier of the Azure resource associated with the device.
columns.Name: AzureResourceId

columns.Description: Unique identifier of the Azure subscription associated with the device
columns.Name: AzureVmSubscriptionId

columns.Description: Unique identifier specific to Google Cloud Platform devices, containing a combination of zone and ID
columns.Name: GcpFullResourceName

columns.Description: Unique identifier specific to Amazon Web Services devices, containing the Amazon Resource Name
columns.Name: AwsResourceName

columns.Description: Indicates whether this device is classified as short-lived or transient based on the frequency of appearance of the device on the network
columns.Name: IsTransient

columns.Description: Build revision number of the operating system running on the machine
columns.Name: OsBuildRevision

columns.Description: Device ID of the device running Windows Subsystem for Linux
columns.Name: HostDeviceId

columns.Description: Indicates the mitigation action applied to a device
columns.Name: MitigationStatus

columns.Description: Type of connectivity from the device to the cloud
columns.Name: ConnectivityType

columns.Description: Products or services that have seen or reported the device, including when they last reported it
columns.Name: DiscoverySources
